intro: Matricaria halleri, commonly known as the lesser tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat hairy. Matricaria halleri is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
